raw.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1755

### Summary & Motivation

The [StableSurge](https://medium.com/balancer-protocol/balancers-stablesurge-hook-09d2eb20f219) hook has been deployed by the Balancer Labs team marking an exciting milestone for Balancer V3 as the first wave of hooks are hitting production. With these innovations come additional permissions related to the management of each hooks unique parameters. In the case of StableSurge the maxSurgeFeePercentage and surgeThresholdPercentage are key factors in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers. This proposal will act to grant the permissions to change both of these parameters to the Balancer Maxis on all currently deployed networks, Ethereum Mainnet, Gnosis, Arbitrum, and Base.

**Technical Specification:**

All deployments and action-ids can be verified in this StableSurgePoolFactory [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/pull/163/files#diff-17e7d1b01753c19be2eee514c14e09736db3af94d24025c7fd9876c73b6e7950).

**Ethereum**

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Arbitrum**

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x261258d23af1013ceb3a0574a5f194e3d4d09a07c0b9014665519c3f1b37f792`, `0x5968f4b1f98171ccadc78df4f25cf8262b250f2f12a83c45b7311b4674d23e0a`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Base**

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0xe81edd4ccc5901443972e580b5d997ced38f33bd4f7e9bca8829dc5efcca6fed`, `0x4a7d099f7d634af69cf552b5b1c76ed8d44074051cbca5a59b842154288b96f1`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Gnosis**

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-685] Grant LM Multisig permission to set_reward_distributor
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-685] Grant LM Multisig permission to set_reward_distributor
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR With Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1294

**Summary**

Grant the LM multisig permission to set the reward token distributor for any reward token on the gauge contracts

**Motivation**

The Gauge contract that is in use by Balancer allows for several additional reward tokens to be added on top of BAL. Each of these reward tokens as a so-called “distributor” assigned which has certain powers:

* Top up the gauge contract with more of the reward token.
* Restart a new epoch for the reward token before the current one is stopped.
* Set the distributor of the reward token to a different wallet address

In addition to the distributor, the DAO multisig is also allowed to change the distributor of any reward token on a gauge, which is used as a backup solution. This is useful if a new reward token was initialized with a wrong distributor address or when the current distributor is not responsive.

If the DAO multisig needs to act on this, it will always require a governance vote which makes the process transparent but also cumbersome. Changing the distributor of a reward token in a gauge is an operational decision and should therefore not require a governance vote but should nevertheless be handled carefully.

This proposal aims to grant the LM Multisig on each chain the power to change the distributor of any reward token on gauges, the same power that the DAO multisig currently has. This helps streamline the operations for reward tokens. The LM multisig signer will only initiate distributor changes after the request has been validated. For example, if the distributor was mis-configured to a wrong address or if the distributor lost access to the wallet.

**Technical Specification:**

The DAO Multisig will interact with the `Authorizer` on each respective network calling `grantRole`, corresponding to the `set_reward_distributor` role on each of Balancer's deployed networks. Reference the table below for each address, role, and link to deployment id.

|Network|Dao Multisig Address|Authorizer |LM Multisig|actionId (role)|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|Arbitrum|0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860|0xa7ed295af0b197c9481510d6c8326ba2e2d17b2c1a89ab1834ac80de9220b60e|
|Avalanche|0x17b11FF13e2d7bAb2648182dFD1f1cfa0E4C7cf3|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0x326A7778DB9B741Cb2acA0DE07b9402C7685dAc6|0xce713085e9498c958964f4c64979785027e7a93323b68bca8e87296c696fa643|
|Base|0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462|0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a|0x65226673F3D202E0f897C862590d7e1A992B2048|0x82f054fdfa86620d25b289d7f068681a5224bcfc083243cdb49512fe1574a36f|
|Ethereum|0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860|0xd0090a09f425bba74e6c801fba7c6d15b44147ab0bd319e40076ce07e95168b6|
|Gnosis|0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0x14969B55a675d13a1700F71A37511bc22D90155a|0x9d575f62420250ec382e1e8e262ddae46d0d6817fab9fde48f9c6efd068e5844|
|Polygon|0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860|0x363cf2bd771efe16bd206d33a549d4698c4ad202ea6b5bf693722fbe151140a6|
|Polygon zkEVM|0x2f237e7643a3bF6Ef265dd6FCBcd26a7Cc38dbAa|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0xB59Ab49CA8d064E645Bf2c546d9FE6d1d4147a09|0xa68f8859aea0e52f285bf8615e8d0b1c2421e59f342cfea2e496bb19738e86ea|
|Optimism|0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0x09Df1626110803C7b3b07085Ef1E053494155089|0xd0090a09f425bba74e6c801fba7c6d15b44147ab0bd319e40076ce07e95168b6|

raw.title: [BIP-288] Disable last generation pool factories
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/176

### Motivation

Recently Balancer contributors released a new generation of pool factories with the only change being the introduction of `create2` when deploying new pools. [BIP-253](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-253-permission-granting-for-managed-v2-composablestable-v4-weighted-v4-factories/4662) granted permissions to some of these new factories and another BIP being prepared now will grant permissions to all of the remaining ones. 

To ensure everyone only uses the latest generation it is prudent to disable the old factories.


### Specification

[details="Ethereum"]

The DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

roles: `0x0df3339673f8356288d97461676bb443e5def15e6d6e8321add702ef77075160,0xa010f28803768154a04542ff29718c73ff40e307b10e5f39fbdff6c90db7b4ec,0xe718df4ad5522c83ea7c41eb474c22b1633a63b63398fc1dd156aadd736f240b,0x3fad985e82b2b68120f2bbe4c05b3bcbb41b29519eaa63fb25cb25833043f1e8,0x50f3f826f5b6f34e6b9291e41967ce5c8f5cbd998ab8b3f740cf2bb02e2e6ea0,0xb1bb0315049487d8b225a40fc17d5a02647e84002cfa5b11eda57b967629f72c,0xdf42af2dd96057a6f29e617c9d6c389e3ac79347b2e4d0b06b8d33cd7e15c40b,0xc6d41c26426784c7fab7298da04eab2259046b3c7c8351286ee364e4e0a3bd1e,0xa29d20c33a203d4663b49d6135fd5876558c9bf107a898f7a0e95357ec2e42b1`


[details="These correspond to the role for calling `disable()` on the following factories (contract addresses included):"]
Weighted Pool v3 -> `0x5Dd94Da3644DDD055fcf6B3E1aa310Bb7801EB8b`
 Managed Pool -> `0x9Ac3E70dB606659Bf32D4BdFbb687AD193FD1F5B`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 -> `0x7d833FEF5BB92ddb578DA85fc0c35cD5Cc00Fb3e`
Composable Stable Pool v3 -> `0xdba127fBc23fb20F5929C546af220A991b5C6e01`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v4 -> `0xb9F8AB3ED3F3aCBa64Bc6cd2DcA74B7F38fD7B88`
ERC4626 Linear Pool v3 -> `0x67A25ca2350Ebf4a0C475cA74C257C94a373b828`
Euler Linear Pool -> `0x5F43FBa61f63Fa6bFF101a0A0458cEA917f6B347`
Yearn Linear Pool -> `0x8b7854708c0C54f9D7d1FF351D4F84E6dE0E134C`
Gearbox Linear Pool -> `0x2EbE41E1aa44D61c206A94474932dADC7D3FD9E3`
[/details]
 
account: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

This grants all the above roles to the DAO Multisig.

Then, the DAO Multisig will call `disable()` on each of the factories.
[/details]
 
[details="Polygon"]

The DAO Multisig `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

[details="These correspond to the role for calling `disable()` on the following factories (contract addresses included):"]
 Managed Pool -> `0x9Ac3E70dB606659Bf32D4BdFbb687AD193FD1F5B`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 -> `0x35c425234DC42e7402f54cC54573f77842963a56`

This grants all the above roles to the DAO Multisig.

Then, the DAO Multisig will call `disable()` on each of the factories.
[/details]

[details="Arbitrum"]

The DAO Multisig `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

[details="These correspond to the role for calling `disable()` on the following factories (contract addresses included):"]
 Managed Pool -> `0x956CCab09898C0AF2aCa5e6C229c3aD4E93d9288`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 -> `0xa2D801064652A269D92EE2A59F3261155ec66830`

[/details]
 
account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

This grants all the above roles to the DAO Multisig.

Then, the DAO Multisig will call `disable()` on each of the factories.
[/details]

[details="Optimism"]

The DAO Multisig `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

raw.title: [BIP-272] Weighted Pool v1 Permission Granting
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
#### PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/157

### Motivation

Vesta Finance has requested the swap fee be changed on WETH/VSTA [Arbitrum] to 1% but the Maxis currently lack the role to do so. They plan to use this pool as part of a staking/farming system. This proposal grants the Maxi LM multisig on Arbitrum the role for changing swap fees on v1 weighted pools on Arbitrum.

### Specification

The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x6213e9042b9814b9567bde72d3c7a61372862c3ac88c2df77d3205221af6c871`

can be confirmed [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/master/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L72). 

account: `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`

which corresponds to the Maxi LM Multisig, confirmed [here](https://quark-ceres-740.notion.site/Multisig-List-Guidelines-402e18cff13e4f2fa571bc14ed007546).

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-276] Enable new L2 gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### [PR with Payload](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/162)

### Motivation

Balancer contributors recently completed development on new non-ethereum ("L2") gauges which feature the ability to have cross chain reward boosts via Layer Zero. In order for these new gauges to function properly each child chain factory on L2 must be added to the pseudo minter on that network. If this is not done then BAL emissions cannot flow through the new gauges.


### Specification


### Arbitrum
#1
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x57f5e3be3930b0a9235265a5237eb44d5ec61fe36999757360b72280c4dcd991`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal seeks to grant permission to manage the amplification parameter for StableSurge pools, enabling more efficient swaps and fee adjustments during volatility. Voting timeline shows unanimous support, and forum discussion is neutral but informative. Historical similar proposals also passed with similar changes but had short term market declines, highlighting the need for careful monitoring.
key_arguments_for: Granting amplification parameter change permissions allows the StableSurge pools to adapt slippage and fees dynamically, improving efficiency and adoption.
Voting timeline shows strong, stable, and early support with all votes for 'Yes, let's do it'.
The technical specification includes careful multisig role assignments across multiple networks ensuring controlled permission granting.
key_arguments_against: Historical similar proposals with similar permission changes experienced negative short term token price and TVL impacts, suggesting potential market risk.
No direct negative comments were found in the forum, but neutral sentiment may indicate some community caution.

evidence.quote: Forum discussion has 2 neutral sentiment comments explaining technical details and linking to snapshot proposal.
Voting timeline shows unanimous lead and stable early voting for 'Yes, let's do it' option.
Similar permission grants passed with 'Yes, let's do it' but had negative price and TVL impacts post-vote.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline indicates unanimous and early support for the 'Yes, let's do it' option, demonstrating strong community backing.
- Forum sentiment is neutral, providing no opposition and generally informative context, aligning with the vote outcome.
- Historical similar proposals granted similar permissions but experienced negative short term price and TVL impacts, suggesting market risks that should be monitored.
- Granting these permissions is expected to improve StableSurge pool efficiency and adaptability, which benefits the protocol's long-term health.
- The recommendation aligns with aggregated forum sentiment and voting dynamics, supporting a change stance while cautioning about market impact lessons.
